definitions.definition: One who attends; one who works with or watches over something.
definitions.example: Give your keys to the parking attendants and they will park your car for you.

definitions.definition: A servant or valet.
A visitor or caller.
That which accompanies or follows.
One who owes a duty or service to another.
Going with; associated; concomitant.
definitions.example: They promoted him to supervisor, with all the attendant responsibilities and privileges.

definitions.definition: Depending on, or owing duty or service to.
definitions.example: the widow attendant to the heir

definitions.definition: To make something flat or flatter.
definitions.example: As there was a lot of damage, we chose the heavy roller to flatten the pitch.

definitions.definition: To press one's body tightly against a surface, such as a wall or floor, especially in order to avoid being seen or harmed.
To knock down or lay low.
definitions.example: The prize fighter quickly flattened his challenger.

definitions.definition: To become flat or flatter; to plateau.
definitions.example: Prices have flattened out.

definitions.definition: To be knocked down or laid low.
To lower by a semitone.
To make vapid or insipid; to render stale.
To reduce (a data structure) to one that has fewer dimensions, e.g. a 2×2 array into a list of four elements.
To combine (separate layers) into a single image.
A shin of beef.
definitions.example: lean sirloin, skink and pot-roast

definitions.definition: A soup or pottage made from a boiled shin of beef.
(by extension) Usually preceded by a descriptive word: a soup or pottage made using other ingredients.
definitions.example: Cullen skink

definitions.definition: A lizard of the family Scincidae, having small or reduced limbs or none at all and long tails that are regenerated when shed.
A drink.
To serve (a drink).
To give as a present.

A toy consisting of a spheroidal or cylindrical spindle having a circular groove in which string is wound; it is used by holding the string in the fingers and reeling the spindle up and down by movements of the wrist.
definitions.example: I bought a yo-yo from the toy store yesterday.

definitions.definition: A volatile market that moves up and down.
Someone who vacillates.
A cloth rosette formed by gathering the outside edge of a circle of fabric in toward the centre using a running stitch.
A foolish, annoying or incompetent person.
definitions.example: It is hard to watch the management for very long and not conclude that the place is run by a bunch of yo-yos.

definitions.definition: To vacillate; to move up and down.
The state of being convivial
A jovial spirit or activity
Prejudice or bias against persons on the basis of their skin color or complexion, often among persons of the same racial identification.
A style of painting characterised by the use of intense color.
Having red hair
Having a red head
A modification that can be applied to an object, like a texture, but changes the object's shape rather than its appearance.
To form by sculpture.
definitions.example: They sculpted a statue out of clay.

definitions.definition: To work as a sculptor.
An inscription in stone.
A brief but witty saying.
A short, witty or pithy poem.
Methamphetamine, especially in the form of the crystalline hydrochloride.
Methadone.
(Mancunian) A tramp.
A spiced mead, originally from Wales.
The central business and shopping area of a city.
Very hungry.
Grasping; characterized by strong desires.
A house or shelter for a dog.
A facility at which dogs are reared or boarded.
definitions.example: She raises registered Dalmatians at her kennel.

definitions.definition: (collective) The dogs kept at such a facility; a pack of hounds.
The hole of a fox or other animal.
To house or board a dog (or less commonly another animal).
definitions.example: While we're away our friends will kennel our pet poodle.

definitions.definition: To lie or lodge; to dwell, as a dog or a fox.
To drive (a fox) to covert in its hole.
The gutter at the edge of a street; a surface drain.
A puddle.
Noble, kind and generous
A small shop, especially one that sells fashionable clothes, jewelry and the like.
A small shop located within a larger one.
A film production company making only a few movies per year.
Specialized in bespoke or custom-made products or services for clientele in a niche market.
definitions.example: a boutique law firm

definitions.definition: The state or quality of being eager; ardent desire.
Tartness; sourness
The body or class of people who frequent an establishment or purchase a service, especially when considered as forming a more-or-less homogeneous group of clients in terms of values or habits.
definitions.example: Helen's clientele encompasses a broad range of different ages, races and social statuses.

definitions.definition: A merry-go-round (type of ride on rotating platform).
A continuously revolving device for item delivery.
definitions.example: After collecting his suitcase at the baggage carousel, he left the airport.

definitions.definition: The rotating glass plate in a microwave oven.
A visual component that displays a horizontal series of items one at a time.
An equestrian discipline in which groups of riders make various formations.
A tilting match or tournament accompanied by games, shows, and allegorical performances.
The expense of a business not directly assigned to goods or services provided.
The items or classes of expense not directly assigned to goods or services provided.
Any cost or expenditure (monetary, time, effort or otherwise) incurred in a project or activity, which does not directly contribute to the progress or outcome of the project or activity.
Wasted money.
A smash.
The ceiling of any enclosed space below decks in a vessel.
A compartment above the seats for stowing luggage in a passenger aircraft.
The system of overhead wires used to power electric transport, such as streetcars, trains, or buses.
Data or steps of computation used only to facilitate the computations in the system and not directly related to the actual program code or data being processed.
definitions.example: Network overhead is the header data that is required to route and transport data over network, whereas fork overhead is the additional time and memory cost of creating and managing new processes within operating system.

definitions.definition: (by ellipsis) An overhead throw.
An overhead projector.
A sheet of transparent material with an image used with an overhead projector; an overhead transparency.
A large, semi-aquatic, herbivorous (plant-eating) African mammal (Hippopotamus amphibius)
A person with an antisocial personality disorder, exhibiting antisocial behavior that usually is the result of social and environmental factors in the person's early life.
A confection usually made from crushed sesame seeds and honey. It is a traditional dessert in South Asia, the Mediterranean and the Middle East.
The process by which an organism produces others of its kind; breeding, propagation, procreation, reproduction.
The act of increasing or rising; augmentation, amplification, enlargement, escalation, aggrandizement.
The result of building up; buildup, accretion.
The spread of biochemical, nuclear and other weapons of mass destruction to countries not originally involved in developing them.
A female deity.
A woman honored or adored as physically attractive or of superior charm and intelligence.
A woman of substantial authority or influence.
One of the long benches in a church, seating several persons, usually fixed to the floor and facing the chancel.
definitions.example: In many churches some pews are reserved for either clerical or liturgical officials such as canons, or for prominent families.

definitions.definition: An enclosed compartment in a church which provides seating for a group of people, often a prominent family.
Any structure shaped like a church pew, such as a stall, formerly used by money lenders, etc.; a box in a theatre; or a pen or sheepfold.
A chair; a seat.
definitions.example: Pull up a pew.

definitions.definition: To furnish with pews.
An expression of disgust in response to an unpleasant odor.
Representative of the sound made by the firing of a gun.
Any of several trees, of the genus Jacaranda, native to tropical South America, that have pale purple, funnel-shaped flowers.
The hard, dark wood of these trees.
A trade name for similar hardwood timber from certain species of Dalbergia, notably Dalbergia frutescens, Dalbergia nigra and Dalbergia refusa.
A social and economic class lying above the working class and below the upper class.
(plural) The groups in society composed of professionals, semi-professionals, and lower to middle managerial level workers.
A persistent young offender; an antisocial minor, one who has committed criminal acts such as theft or violence.
Horrified so as to be overwhelmed or incapacitated.
High, tall, having great height or stature
Idealistic, implying over-optimism
definitions.example: a lofty goal

definitions.definition: Extremely proud; arrogant; haughty
One who adheres to the theory or method of impressionism.
The surgical discipline focused on treating those central and peripheral nervous system diseases.
Any surgical procedure performed on the brain; brain surgery.
A swirling body of water.
definitions.example: A whirlpool is an instance of a vortex produced by ocean tides, or by a hole underneath where the water would drain out, such as in a bathtub.

definitions.definition: A hot tub, jacuzzi.
Turmoil, or agitated excitement.
To spin or swirl like the water in a whirlpool.
The deliberate omission of something.
The omission of a letter or syllable between two words; sometimes marked with an apostrophe.
One who holds the view that environment, rather than heredity or culture, is the primary factor in the development of an individual or group.
One who advocates for the protection of the biosphere from misuse from human activity through such measures as ecosystem protection, waste reduction and pollution prevention
Of, or relating to environmentalism.
A pleasant taste
Enjoyment; pleasure.
A quality or characteristic tinge.
(followed by "for") A taste (for); liking (of); fondness.
A cooked or pickled sauce, usually made with vegetables or fruits, generally used as a condiment.
In a wooden frame, the projection or shoulder at the side of, or around, a tenon, on a tenoned piece.
Something that is greatly liked or savoured.
To taste or eat with pleasure, to like the flavor of
To take great pleasure in.
definitions.example: He relishes their time together.

definitions.definition: To taste; to have a specified taste or flavour.
To give a taste to; to cause to taste nice, to make appetizing.
To give pleasure.
Extreme shortage of food in a region.
A period of extreme shortage of food in a region.
Starvation or malnutrition.
Severe shortage or lack of something.
A beverage made by infusing the leaves of various herbs, generally not including true tea (Camellia sinensis).
In violation of one or more of the rules and conventions of a language as defined by the grammar, resulting in unacceptable or incorrect usage.

A philosophical belief in the existence of a god (or goddess) knowable through human reason; especially, a belief in a creator god unaccompanied by any belief in supernatural phenomena or specific religious doctrines.
Belief in a god who ceased to intervene with existence after acting as the cause of the cosmos.
Distended beyond the natural state by some internal agent, especially fluid, or expansive force.
definitions.example: I have a turgid limb.

definitions.definition: (of language or style) Overly complex and difficult to understand; grandiloquent; bombastic.
A grotesque representation of a figure; a gargoyle.
A caricature.
(often in plural) A ludicrous gesture or act; ridiculous behaviour; caper.
A grotesque performer or clown, buffoon.
Playful, funny, absurd
Grotesque, incongruous.
Grotesque, bizarre
A pose, often exaggerated, in anticipation of an action; for example, a brief squat before jumping
In general, anything very old; specifically:
A style of type of thick and bold face in which all lines are of equal or nearly equal thickness.
To search or shop for antiques.
To make an object appear to be an antique in some way.
To emboss without gilding.
Having existed in ancient times, descended from antiquity; used especially in reference to Greece and Rome.
Belonging to former times, not modern, out of date, old-fashioned.
Designating a style of type.
Embossed without gilt.
An unconventionally modern style of fashionable dress originating in England in the 1960s, characterized by ankle-length black trenchcoats and sunglasses.
A 1960s British person who dressed in such a style and was interested in modernism and the modern music of the time; the opposite of a rocker.
A modification.
An end user-created package containing modifications to the look or behaviour of a video game.
A moderator, for example on a discussion forum.
A module (file containing a tracker music sequence).
A moderately difficult route.
(in the plural, Oxford University) Moderations: university examinations generally taken in the first year.
To modify (an object) from its original condition, typically for the purposes of individualizing and/or enhancing the performance of the object.
definitions.example: His friends were particularly impressed with the way he modded his Ruckus.

definitions.definition: To moderate; to silence or punish (a rule-breaking user) on a forum, especially when done by a moderator.
definitions.example: Don't break the rules or you'll be modded.

definitions.definition: One of several ancient Greek scales.
One of several common scales in modern Western music, one of which corresponds to the modern major scale and one to the natural minor scale.
A particular means of accomplishing something.
definitions.example: What was the mode of entry?

definitions.definition: A particular state of being, or frame of mind.
definitions.example: After a series of early setbacks, her political campaign is in crisis mode.

definitions.definition: The most frequently occurring value in a distribution
A state of a system that is represented by an eigenfunction of that system.
One of various related sets of rules for processing data; more generally, any state of the system associated with certain behaviours.
definitions.example: In insert mode, characters typed are directly inserted into the buffer.

definitions.definition: A series of settings on a device used for a specific purpose.
definitions.example: airplane mode; night mode

definitions.definition: A variation in gameplay, such as a difficulty level.
(grammar) A verb form that depends on how its containing clause relates to the speaker’s or writer’s wish, intent, or assertion about reality.
That which exists only as a quality of substance.
In lace-making, a small decorative piece inserted into a pattern.
The openwork between the solid parts of a pattern.
A woman's mantle with a hood.
Style or fashion; popular trend.
definitions.example: Her wardrobe is always in mode.

definitions.definition: Not excessive; acting in moderation
definitions.example: a moderate Calvinist

definitions.definition: Mediocre
Average priced; standard-deal
Not violent or rigorous; temperate; mild; gentle.
definitions.example: a moderate winter

definitions.definition: Having an intermediate position between liberal and conservative.
The base with respect to which a congruence is computed.
The absolute value of a complex number.
A coefficient that expresses how much of a certain property is possessed by a certain substance.
An operator placed between two numbers, to get the remainder of the division of those numbers.
A festival of Scottish Gaelic song, arts and culture, akin to the Welsh eisteddfod.
Plants, taken collectively.
definitions.example: There were large amounts of vegetation in the forest.

definitions.definition: An abnormal verrucous or fibrinous growth
The act or process of vegetating, or growing as a plant does; vegetable growth.
A row of arches.
A covered passage, usually with shops on both sides.
An establishment that runs coin-operated games.
The point in the sky vertically above a given position or observer; the point in the celestial sphere opposite the nadir.
The highest point in the sky reached by a celestial body.
(by extension) Highest point or state; peak.
definitions.example: Winning the continental championship was the zenith of my career.

definitions.definition: An almost transparent aquatic animal; any one of the acalephs, especially one of the larger species, having a jellylike appearance.
The Elettaria cardamomum, an Indian herb.
The seed of E. cardamomum, used as a medicine and spice, especially in curry powder.
The seeds or seed capsules of the Aframomum melegueta, used as a medicine and spice, especially as a substitute for black pepper and in flavoring alcoholic beverages.
The Aframomum melegueta itself, a herbaceous perennial plant native to the swamps of the West African coast.
A liquid, a fluid.
A drinkable liquid.
A liquid obtained by cooking meat or vegetables (or both).
A parsley sauce commonly served with traditional pies and mash.
Strong alcoholic drink derived from fermentation and distillation; more broadly, any alcoholic drink.

In process industry, a liquid in which a desired reaction takes place, e.g. pulping liquor is a mixture of chemicals and water which breaks wood into its components, thus facilitating the extraction of cellulose.
A liquid in which something has been steeped.
To drink liquor, usually to excess.
To cause someone to drink liquor, usually to excess.
To grease.
Medicine to be administered to the eyes.
A tear.
(in the plural) The resins of the tree Aquilaria malaccensis (syn. Aquilaria agallocha), known for their fragrant aroma, produced after infection by the fungus Phialophora parasitica.
A plant of the genus Aloe.
A strong, bitter drink made from the juice of such plants, used as a purgative.
Eternity.
A period of 1,000,000,000 years.
The longest time period used in geology.
A long period of time.
definitions.example: It's been eons since we last saw each other.

definitions.definition: (usually spelled aeon or æon) A spirit being emanating from the Godhead.
A member of an online subculture of people (mostly men) who define themselves as unable to find a romantic or sexual partner despite desiring one.
definitions.example: 2018 Alex Hern, Who are the 'incels' and how do they relate to Toronto van attack? The Guardian

definitions.definition: Anyone who is not sexually active despite desiring to be.
(pickup community) "Involuntary celibacy": the state of not being sexually active despite wishing to be.
(pickup community) Not having sexual relations despite wishing to.
An overly inquisitive or prying person
To snoop; to behave in an inquisitive manner.
A slightly yellowish gray colour, as that of unbleached wool.
Debeige; a kind of woollen or mixed dress goods.
Having a slightly yellowish gray colour, as that of unbleached wool.
Comfortably dull and unadventurous, in a way that suggests middle-class suburbia.
To postpone.
definitions.example: The trial was adjourned for a week.

definitions.definition: To defer; to put off temporarily or indefinitely.
To end or suspend an event.
definitions.example: The court will adjourn for lunch.

definitions.definition: To move as a group from one place to another.
definitions.example: After the dinner, we will adjourn to the bar.

definitions.definition: Confidence, pride.
A bold or arrogant strut.
A prideful boasting or bragging.
To walk with a swaying motion; hence, to walk and act in a pompous, consequential manner.
To boast or brag noisily; to be ostentatiously proud or vainglorious; to bluster; to bully.
Fashionable; trendy.
An itinerant person who walks from farm to farm carrying a swag and seeking work, often in exchange for food and lodging.
A fence, a middleman for transactions of stolen goods.
A very thin stripe on a fabric.
Such a fabric.
A suit made of such fabric.
To recover ownership of something by buying it back.
To liberate by payment of a ransom.
To set free by force.
To save, rescue
To clear, release from debt or blame
To expiate, atone (for)
To convert (some bond or security) into cash
To save from a state of sin (and from its consequences).
To repair, restore
To reform, change (for the better)
To restore the honour, worth, or reputation of oneself or something.
To reclaim
A plant that requires two years to complete its life-cycle, germinating and growing in its first year, then producing its flowers and fruit in its second year, after which it usually dies
An event that happens every two years
Happening every two years.
Lasting for two years.
A folder or booklet containing preprinted cheques for use by the holder of a bank account
A length of cord about a metre long with a narrow cylindrical weight at one end and loops at the other. Used for cleaning rifle barrels, by pulling through a piece of cloth.
To come through pain and trouble through perseverance
To clean the barrel of a firearm using a pull through
The process of a liquid converting to the gaseous state.
The process in which all or a portion of liquid (in a container) is turned into vapour, in order to increase the concentration of solid matter in the mixture.
That which is evaporated; vapor.
The act of merging separate elements, or the result thereof.
To combine; to fuse
A sport involving the performance of sequences of movements requiring physical strength, flexibility, and kinesthetic awareness.
definitions.example: Gymnastics was a significant part of the physical education curriculum.

definitions.definition: Complex intellectual or artistic exercises or feats of physical agility.
definitions.example: His mental gymnastics are legendary.

definitions.definition: The quality of smoothness of flow.
The quality of being fluent in a language; A person's command of a particular language.
The quality of consistently applying skill correctly in the manner of one well-practiced at it, requiring little deliberate thought to perform without mistakes
Someone who supports or heralds the establishment of a utopia.
Ideal but often impractical; visionary.
definitions.example: a utopian project

definitions.definition: Of or pertaining to or resembling a utopia.
definitions.example: utopian happiness

definitions.definition: To cause a compromised immune system.
Having an immune system that has been impaired by disease or treatment.
To come towards, to approach.
definitions.example: I was standing on the corner when Nick came up and asked for a cigarette.

definitions.definition: To emerge or become known, especially unexpectedly.
definitions.example: Unless anything comes up, I'll be there every day this week.

definitions.definition: To come to attention, present itself; to arrive or appear.
definitions.example: At some point in the conversation my name came up, and I readily agreed to their proposition.

definitions.definition: To appear (before a judge or court).
definitions.example: He came up before a judge and was fined a thousand dollars.

definitions.definition: To draw near in time.
definitions.example: The summer holidays are coming up.

definitions.definition: (of a heavenly body) To rise (above the horizon).
definitions.example: It'll be warmer once the sun comes up.

definitions.definition: To begin to feel the effects of a recreational drug.
definitions.example: I could tell from her expression that she was coming up already.

definitions.definition: (Oxford University) To arrive at the university. (Compare go down, send down.)
A goalkeeper or goaltender.
A breakfast dish based on uncooked rolled oats and fruit.
The act or situation of relapsing.
definitions.example: a drug relapse

definitions.definition: An occasion when a person becomes ill again after a period of improvement
One who has relapsed, or fallen back into error; a backslider.
To fall back again; to slide or turn back into a former state or practice.
definitions.example: He has improved recently but keeps relapsing into states of utter confusion.

definitions.definition: (of a disease) To recur; to worsen, be aggravated (after a period of improvement).
To slip or slide back physically; to turn back.
The area that runs alongside the court of play.
Located next to the court of play.
definitions.example: They had courtside seats.

definitions.definition: Alongside the court of play.
definitions.example: They sat courtside.

definitions.definition: A party held for a man who is about to be married, normally attended only by male friends and relatives.
